title: Photography
text:
As a wizard and scholar of Middle-earth, I have been studying the magic of the natural world for centuries. Through my self-portraits, I aim to capture the essence of my own being and reflect on my own journey through time. Each photograph is a reflection of my own experiences and emotions. Through my photography, I hope to offer a glimpse into my life as a scholar and adventurer, and inspire others to reflect on their own journeys through the world.

title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
I am currently leading the Dreams-PD trial, a groundbreaking study focused on the impact of sleep disorders in patients with Parkinson’s disease. This trial seeks to explore innovative ways to address sleep disturbances, which are prevalent in this population and significantly affect quality of life. By investigating novel therapeutic interventions, the Dreams-PD study aims to enhance both motor and non-motor outcomes for Parkinson’s patients, offering hope for better management of this complex, progressive disease. Our findings will provide valuable insights into the interconnectedness of sleep and neurodegeneration, potentially influencing future treatment approaches for Parkinson’s disease and other neurodegenerative disorders.

section: Recent Publication in Parkinsonism and Related Disorders (PRD)
text:
Recent Publication in Parkinsonism and Related Disorders (PRD)

arXiv Preprint | Code
I recently published a study in Parkinsonism and Related Disorders (PRD) where I applied TMS-EEG (transcranial magnetic stimulation combined with electroencephalography) to explore the neurophysiological mechanisms underlying Tourette syndrome. This study provides novel insights into the brain’s cortical excitability and connectivity in individuals with Tourette’s, shedding light on the neurobiological basis of tics and the potential for targeted therapies. By utilizing TMS-EEG, we were able to examine real-time brain activity and assess how different neural networks may contribute to the clinical manifestations of Tourette syndrome. The findings open up new possibilities for developing more effective, personalized treatment strategies for patients suffering from this complex disorder.

Saar Anis, MD
Greetings, and welcome to my professional space. I am Dr. Saar Anis, a physician, researcher, and advocate for advancing integrative medical practices that blend the best of modern science with traditional healing. Over the course of my career, I have dedicated myself to the art and science of medicine, with a particular focus on patient-centered care, mental health, and the holistic management of chronic conditions. Through this website, I invite you to explore my work, my ongoing research, and my philosophy towards healthcare, all of which stem from a deep commitment to human well-being.
Research Interests and Expertise
My professional journey has been shaped by a broad range of interests and expertise. As a medical doctor, I am particularly passionate about the intersection of mental health and physical wellness, emphasizing how emotional, psychological, and spiritual health are interwoven with our overall well-being. In addition to clinical care, I have contributed significantly to research in the fields of neurobiology, pain management, and the psychological impacts of chronic illness. My work in these areas has focused on developing innovative treatment protocols that are both effective and compassionate.
Another area of deep interest for me is the role of nutrition and lifestyle in disease prevention and management. I believe that modern medicine can benefit greatly from a more integrative approach, one that embraces both conventional treatments and the healing wisdom found in ancient practices such as Ayurveda and Traditional Chinese Medicine. Through research, clinical trials, and cross-disciplinary collaboration, I strive to better understand how these diverse approaches can complement each other to improve patient outcomes.
Education, Mentorship, and Community Impact
Beyond my research, I am also deeply committed to education and mentorship. Over the years, I have had the privilege of training medical students, residents, and healthcare professionals, helping them to cultivate the critical thinking skills necessary for effective, compassionate care. My teaching philosophy is grounded in the belief that medicine is both an art and a science—one that requires empathy, continuous learning, and the ability to connect with patients as individuals rather than mere cases to be solved.
I also believe in the importance of community engagement and the empowerment of individuals to take an active role in their own health. In my work, I strive to promote wellness not only through clinical care but also through public education initiatives. I have hosted seminars, written articles, and participated in community outreach programs to encourage healthier lifestyles, raise awareness about mental health, and promote overall well-being.
Publications, Projects, and Conferences
This website also serves as a hub for my ongoing projects and scholarly contributions. You will find a collection of my published works, including peer-reviewed journal articles, book chapters, and public health essays. Additionally, I often contribute to medical conferences, workshops, and seminars, sharing insights from my research and engaging with others in the field.
I currently have several ongoing research projects related to the integration of mental health and chronic disease management, the development of new therapeutic protocols, and the study of holistic treatment methodologies. I am always eager to collaborate with other professionals and researchers who share an interest in these areas.
I invite you to browse the website for information on my latest research endeavors, upcoming speaking engagements, and more. I also encourage you to contact me for further discussion on any topics related to healthcare, research collaboration, or education. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.
